episodeTitle: Major Panic! Desperate Struggle at the Auction House
description: After Luffy strikes the Celestial Dragon Charlos, chaos erupts at the Human Auction House as guards attack the Straw Hats. Robin, Brook, and Usopp arrive to reinforce their crew, with Usopp accidentally knocking out another Celestial Dragon, Rosward. As the Marines surround the building and Shalria attempts to kill Camie, the legendary Silvers Rayleigh emerges from backstage, using a powerful burst of Conqueror's Haki to knock out enemies while introducing himself to Luffy.

events.title: Guards Attack the Straw Hats
events.description: Following Luffy's assault on Celestial Dragon Charlos in the previous episode, the auction house guards begin attacking the Straw Hat Pirates. Most observers evacuate except for the Celestial Dragon family, Kid Pirates, and Heart Pirates.
events.significance: Initiates the chaotic battle at the auction house and demonstrates that multiple Supernova crews witness this historic moment.

events.title: Robin, Brook, and Usopp Arrive at the Auction House
events.description: Robin, Brook, and Usopp crash into the Human Auction House on a flying fish mount to join their crewmates. Brook tells the rider to crash inside while Usopp panics about not being ready.
events.significance: Reunites the full Straw Hat crew at the auction house for the first time during this crisis, showing their solidarity despite the danger.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: As he falls through the roof of the auction house

events.title: Usopp Accidentally Knocks Out Celestial Dragon Rosward
events.description: Usopp, standing nervously on the roof after arriving, is pushed by the flying fish and crashes through the ceiling, accidentally falling onto and knocking out Saint Rosward, breaking his glasses in the process.
events.significance: A second Celestial Dragon is assaulted at the auction house (though accidentally), escalating the already dire situation and ensuring even more severe Marine response.

events.title: Marines Surround the Auction House
events.description: The Marines are alerted to Luffy's attack on Charlos and quickly surround the Human Auction House, preparing for a major confrontation with the pirates inside.
events.significance: Demonstrates the World Government's rapid response protocol for Celestial Dragon assaults, foreshadowing the arrival of an Admiral.

events.title: Straw Hats Work to Free Camie
events.description: Zoro cuts the tank holding Camie captive to allow communication while the crew fights off guards. The Straw Hats coordinate to rescue their mermaid friend from her restraints.
events.significance: Shows the crew's determination to save Camie despite the mounting danger from the Marines and potential Admiral arrival.

events.title: Luffy Apologizes for Bringing an Admiral
events.description: Luffy apologizes to his crew, knowing that his actions in punching a Celestial Dragon would bring an Admiral and warship down from Marine Headquarters to Sabaody Archipelago.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's awareness of the consequences of his actions while showing he has no regrets about defending his friends.

quotes.text: Sorry, I know this is going to bring an Admiral here.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Apologizing to his crew for the consequences of punching Charlos

events.title: Kid and Law Observe the Chaos
events.description: Eustass Kid and Trafalgar Law, along with their respective crews, remain in the auction house watching the Straw Hats' actions. Kid remarks that the rumors about Luffy being crazy are true, while Law notes that the Marines had surrounded the house even before the auction began.
events.significance: Establishes the dynamic between the three Supernova captains and shows their different approaches to the situation, setting up future interactions.

quotes.text: The rumors are true - that guy is one crazy pirate.
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Commenting on Luffy's actions after punching a Celestial Dragon

events.title: Shalria Attempts to Kill Camie
events.description: An enraged Saint Shalria, furious about the assault on her family members, attempts to shoot and kill Camie in retaliation for the Straw Hats' actions.
events.significance: Creates a critical moment of danger for Camie and sets up Rayleigh's dramatic intervention.

events.title: Rayleigh Uses Conqueror's Haki
events.description: Just as Shalria is about to kill Camie, a powerful burst of Conqueror's Haki knocks her unconscious. Silvers Rayleigh emerges from backstage, having used his mastered Haki to selectively knock out enemies while leaving the Straw Hats, Kid Pirates, and Heart Pirates conscious.
events.significance: First clear demonstration of precise Conqueror's Haki control in the series, showing that it can be wielded with surgical precision rather than just as an area-of-effect weapon. Introduces one of the most powerful characters in One Piece.

events.title: Silvers Rayleigh Reveals Himself to Luffy
events.description: Silvers Rayleigh, the Dark King and former first mate of the Pirate King Gol D. Roger, emerges from backstage and reveals himself to Luffy, stating that he wanted to meet the young captain whose name he had heard.
events.significance: Introduction of one of the most legendary figures in the One Piece world, Roger's right-hand man, who will become Luffy's mentor in Haki. This meeting sets up critical future training and world-building revelations.

quotes.text: I wanted to meet you, Monkey D. Luffy.
quotes.speaker: Silvers Rayleigh
quotes.context: Introducing himself to Luffy after saving Camie

events.title: Rayleigh's Identity as Roger's First Mate Confirmed
events.description: The characters present recognize or learn that Rayleigh was the first mate of Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King, making him a legendary figure from the previous generation of pirates.
events.significance: Confirms Rayleigh's connection to the Pirate King and establishes his credibility and importance to the One Piece world's history.

events.title: Robin Introduces Trafalgar Law
events.description: Nico Robin identifies Trafalgar Law to Luffy, informing him that Law is a pirate and one of the Supernovas, introducing the formal connection between these two future allies.
events.significance: First formal introduction between Luffy and Law through Robin, setting up their future alliance and relationship.

quotes.text: Sorry, I know this is going to bring an Admiral here.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Apologizing to his crew for the consequences of punching a Celestial Dragon

quotes.text: The rumors are true - that guy is one crazy pirate.
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid

quotes.text: I wanted to meet you, Monkey D. Luffy.
quotes.speaker: Silvers Rayleigh
quotes.context: Introducing himself after using Conqueror's Haki

themes.description: The episode explores the tension between the World Government's laws protecting Celestial Dragons and the moral imperative to protect innocent lives like Camie.
themes.symbolism: The auction house represents the corrupt system that allows slavery, while Luffy's punch symbolizes rejection of unjust authority.

themes.description: Luffy's awareness that his punch will bring an Admiral demonstrates growing maturity while maintaining his core values of protecting friends above all else.
themes.symbolism: The surrounding Marines represent the inevitable consequences of challenging the world order.

themes.description: Rayleigh's appearance represents the passing of wisdom from one generation of pirates to the next, connecting the Pirate King's era to Luffy's journey.
themes.symbolism: Rayleigh emerging from the shadows symbolizes the past generation supporting the new one.

characterSpotlights.development: Shows growth in understanding consequences while refusing to compromise his values. Apologizes for bringing danger but doesn't regret defending Camie.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the battle sequences with the guards, adding more choreography and screen time to the fight scenes.
Additional dialogue was added showing the panic of auction house attendees evacuating.

trivia.fact: This episode introduced the abbreviated preview format for One Piece, with dialogue beginning before the standard opening flourish concludes.
This episode featured a new opening narration format focused on the Straw Hat Pirates and their captain, departing from previous narration styles.
Keiichi Sonobe voices Rayleigh in Japanese, while Bruce Carey provides the English dub voice. The younger version is voiced by Kazuyuki Sogabe (JP) and Bradford Hutson (EN).
